results.definition: an urge to do or say something that might be better left undone or unsaid
examples: he felt a compulsion to babble on about the accident

results.definition: using force to cause something to occur
examples: though pressed into rugby under compulsion I began to enjoy the game

results.definition: an irrational motive for performing trivial or repetitive actions, even against your will
examples: her compulsion to wash her hands repeatedly
